page.title: 14FARMING
page.content: ESSENTIALLY A FARMING COMMUNITY WITH FOURTEEN WORKING FARMS.MANY MEN ARE EMPLOYED AS FARM WORKERS OR FARMERS.WITHIN THE VILLAGE OF SHELDON THE FARM HOUSES DO NOT HAVE THEIR LAND SURROUNDING THEM I.E. THEIR FIELDS COULD BE QUITE A DISTANCE AWAY FROM THE VILLAGE.FOUR FARMS HAVE DAIRY COWS PRODUCING MILK FOR THE MILK MARKETING BOARDTHESE ARE CALLED HEREFERD AND FRIESIAN.OTHERS HAVE BEEF CATTLE AND SHEEP AS IT IS MAINLY HILL FARMING AND NOT ARABLE FARMING.THE CROPS GROWN ARE TO FEED THE FARM ANIMALS AND THE GRASS GROWN IS FOR HAY IN WINTER.BARLEY IS GROWN AT DIRTLOW FARM AND A FEW OTHERS.
